caption.title: Relative frequency of citation (RFC) and use value index (UVI) of the most commonly used indigenous plants by the local people of different areas of Samahni, District Bhimber (AJK), Pakistan.

tr.th: Phytotherapeutic Utilization as EMs and Phytonyms

tr.td: Acacia modesta Wall. Leguminosae; subfamily Mimosaceae MUH-1366
Toothache, cough dysentery, bacterial infections, stimulant, backache, venereal infirmities and leprosy.
Acacia nilotica (L.) Delile M. Leguminosae; subfamily Mimosaceae MUH-1368
Wound healing, fever, cough, cold, toothache, feet infection, sexual disorders, diabetics, body weakness and used as ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Urinary diseases, asthma, stomachache, fever, cough, constipation, diuretic, wound healing, bacterial infections and prolapse problems of cattle as EVMs.
Leaf, root, stem, flower/ extract, tea
Diabetics, skin infection, bacterial and fungal disease wound, bleeding bruises healer, chest infections, edema, inflammation, snake bite, dermatitis and allergy.
Ajuga bracteosa Wall ex Benth. Lamiaceae MUH-1529
Hypertension, jaundice, sore throat and ulcer.
Albizia lebbeck (L.) Benth. Leguminosae; subfamily Mimosaceae MUH-1370
Kidney disorders, wormicide and skin allergy.
Snake bite, sting of scorpion and other poisonous insects and used as EVMs.
Aloe vera (L.) Burm. f. Asphodelaceae MUH-1612
Piles, anal irritation, diabetics, baldness, wound healing, skin diseases, cancer, cardiovascular diseases and used as EVMs.
Diuretic issues, cancer, eye related diseases, anemia and wound healing.
Artemisia scoparia Waldst. & Kit. Asteraceae MUH-1429
Malarial diseases, asthma, diarrhea, nervous, febrifuge and tonic.
Azadirachta indica A. Juss. Meliaceae MUH-1321
Diabetics, intestinal worms, blood purification, microbial diseases, wounds and used as EVMs.
Bauhinia variegata L. Leguminosae; subfamily Caesalpiniaceae MUH-1363
Stomach diseases, bacterial infections, dysentery, hemorrhoids, piles, laxative, wound healing, tumor and snake poison.
Dysentery, hypertension, liver disorders, wound healing, Jaundice, dyspepsia, sore throat and itching.
Boerhavia procumbens Banks ex Roxb. Nyctaginaceae MUH-1535
Leaf, root, whole plant/ tea, decoction
Cough, fever, menstrual pain, flu, sore throat and tumors.
Chest pains and edema or inflammation issues.
Butea monosperma (Lam.) Taub. Leguminosae; subfamily Papilionaceae MUH-1337
Eye diseases, diabetes and kidney disorders.
Asthma, cough, fever, wound healing, snake bite, skin diseases, fungus diseases, scabies and used as EVMs.
Leaf, stem, root, bark/ Decoction, tea
Bacteria and fungi infections, foot or skin allergy.
Carissa opaca Stapf ex Haines. Apocynaceae MUH-1444
Latex, fruit, leaf/ Juice, infusion, tea
Snake and scorpion bite, stomachache, jaundice and hepatitis.
Lice killer, skin diseases, anemia and weakness in children.
Fish killer/ catching used as bio-net, diabetic and urinary disorders.
Cassia fistula L. Leguminosae; subfamily Caesalpiniaceae MUH-1364
Leaf, seeds, pods/ tea, powder, infusion
Stomach problem, asthma, febrifuge and as source ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Seeds edible, bacterial diseases, chest infection and cough.
Spleen and kidney disorders, cancer, gasteroprotective, microbial infections and inflammatory issues.
Wound healing, stomach wormicidal, constipation and piles.
Fever, indigestion, omititng. blood purifier, kideny problems, urinary problems, hapatitis and tooth pains.
Bacterial and fungal diseases or infections, cough and flu.
Emmenagogue, purgative, cathartic, amenorrhea, syphilis, tumors, diabetics, jaundice, rheumatism, urinary problems and snake bite. The plant is also used as ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Body weakness & slimness in childeen and wormicide in goats and animals.
Wormicidal in animals, and to cure tumors or boils.
To elelminate stomach worms in animals, cure boils and tumors.
Fever, flu, wounds, bruises cure and epilepsy.
Constipation, diuretic, febrifuge, treat burns and inflammatory issues.
Diuretic and purgative, fever, loss of memory and fatigue.
Fever, nervous debility, and loss of memory, purgative and body fatigue/muscle pains.
Ascites, dysuria pain, cystitis, fever piles and tumors.
Cordia gharaf (Forssk.) Ehren. ex Asch Boraginaceae MUH-1462
Leaf, root, Stem/ juice, tea, powder
Fever, cough, chest infection, diuretic, demulcent and stomachache.
Diuretic, fever, joints pain, dry cough, throats pain, tonic and stomach ulcer.
Flu, amoebic diseases, bacterial infection, diarrhea, fungal infirmities, inflammations and cough.
Wound healing, skin diseases, fever and respiratory disorders.
Flu, cough, heart issues, asthma and fever.
Insecticidal, baldness, wound healing, antiseptic, sedative, narcotic, asthma and mosquito repellant.
Insecticide, antipyretic, narcotic, verimicidal, cold and fever in cattle as EVM. It is used for early copulation and pregnancy in cow/ buffaloes.
Dropsy treatment, skin rashes, spleen enlargement, hemorrhage and irritations.
Spleen disorders, fever, skin allergies and cough.
Stomach problems, nerve tonic and aphrodisiac agent.
Bacterial and fungal diseases, skin rashes, hair fall and oxidative stress.
Body fatigue, rashes, lice killer, mosquito repellant, laxative and used as fodder for cattle and EVMs.
Wormicidal, skin rashes and purgative purpose.
Microbial disease/ infections, skin diseases and respiratory diseases.
Diarrhea, bacterial infections, diabetics, inflammatory problems.
Snake bite, scorpion bite and immune disorders.
Skin diseases, anemia, kidney diseases and microbial infections.
Diuretic, cough, chest infections and vomiting.
Stem, fruit, leaf/ tea, decoction, powder
Toothache, constipation, chest infections, oral infection and gastrointestinal.
Stem, leaf, fruit, latex/ decoction, tea
Spermatogenesis, skin diseases, diabetes and toothache.
Stomach disorders i.e. ulcers, and sexual disorders, diabetes, tonic, laxative and toothache.
Asthma, dysentery, diabetes, wounds healing, epilepsy, diarrhea, fever, gastritis, inflammation, infectious and sexual disorders.
Ficus semicordata Buch.-Ham. ex Smith Moraceae MUH-1599
Toothache, gums bleeding, Asthma, digestive problems, skin diseases, inflammation and diabetes.
Skin diseases, diabetes, tonic, respiratory and chest disorders, fungal allergy and toothache.
Stomachache, diarrhea, respiratory infections, piles, diabetes, liver disorder and urinary diseases.
Flacourtia indica (Burm. f.) Merill. Flacourtiaceae MUH-1290
Liver disorderes, malaria cure, snakebite and arthritis.
Colic pains, stomachache, constipation, tumors and haemorrhoids.
Grewia optiva J.R. Drumm. ex Burret. Tiliaceae MUH-1304
Stem, leaf, fruit/ tea, extract, infusion, paste
Aphrodisiac, wound healing, prolapse of placenta and as EVMs.
Cancer, rheumatic, purgative, wound healing and hypertension.
Cancer and other tumors issues; eczema problems and skin diseases.
Fever, encephalitis, viral infections and skin problems.
Body tonic, constipation, teeth cleanser, chronic cough, asthma, flu, bacterial infections and dyspepsia.
Wound healing, septic problems, abortifacient, arthritis, chest pain, wound healing, diabetes, cancer and as EVMs.
Diabetes, wound healing, sores, skin irriatations, irritation, diarrhoea and cuts cure.
Inflammations, viral infections, diabetics, flu and chest infections.
Feet inflammations, sprains, body swellings, ulcers, elephantiasis and used as EVMs.
Wound healing, gonorrhea, cardial pains, inflammation, cancer and broken bones.
Fever, cough, other bacterial and fungal diseases.
Diabetes, sexual infertility, cancer, skin diseases, boils, setting dislocated bones and extracting pus.
Diabetes, cancer, Parkinsonâs disease, coronary heart disease, skin diseases and boils.
Mallotus philipiensis (Lamk.) Muell. Arg. Euphorbiaceae MUH-1567
Urinary issues, vulnerary, diuretic, skin disorders, heating, purgative, anthelmintic and rodents killer.
Skin diseases, cough, inflammatory problems, ulcers, microbial diseases and cure of dandruff.
Stomachache, stomatitis, wormicide, glossitis, wounds healing, oral thrush and abscesses.
Aphrodisiac, chest disorders. antinociceptive, inflammation issues, analgesic and bacterial diseases.
Maytenus royleana (Wall. ex M.A. Lawson.) Cufd. Celastraceae MUH-1324
Microbial infection, analgesic, gastric ulcers, inflammation problems and allergy.
Medicago polymorpha L. Leguminosae; subfamily: Papilionaceae MUH-1347
Fever in goats/ cattle, laxative, constipation, soar throat and used as EVMs.
Medicago laciniata var. laciniata L. Leguminosae; subfamily: Papilionaceae MUH-1349
Constipation, fever, microbial infirmities and milk yield enhancer.
Seed, leaf bark/ decoction, poultice, tea
Asthma, blood purifier, diabetes, germicide, diuretic and used as EVMs.
Melilotus alba L. Leguminosae; subfamily Papilionaceae MUH-1352
Fever, carminative, emollient, indigestion, flatulence and used as EVMs.
Melilotus indica (L.) All. Leguminosae; subfamily Papilionaceae MUH-1350
Diarrhea, emollient, fever, skin rash, tumors, wound healing, gastrointestinal and used as EVMs.
Leaf, whole plant/ decoction, powder, tea
Indigestion, carminative, dyspepsia, diarrhea and dysentery, stomachache, allergy and used as EVMs.
Diabetics, anticholestrol, diuretic, headache and used as EVMs.
Indigestion, dyspepsia, cholestrol, diuretic and headache, stomach problems and used as EVMs.
Leaf, fruit, seed, bark/ powder, decoction
Tooth pains, stomach ulcers, asthma, diabetes, fatty liver, inflammatory problems, infertility, oxidative stress and cardiovascular issues.
Sore throat, cough, fever, toothache and used as EVMs.
Sore throat, inflammatory disorders, urinary problems, cough, fever and used as EVMs.
Flu, fever and sore throat problems, disorders and urinary problems.
Anemia, cough, flu, sore throat, disorders, urinary problems and used as EVM.
Stomach pain, skin diseases, toothache, ear and eye problems and repellant of insects.
Haemorrhoids, wound healing, snake and scorpions stingsâ pains.
Olea ferruginea Wall. ex Aitch. Oleaceae MUH-1443
Flu, cough, jaundice and liver problems, gonorrhea, blood purifier. The branches are used as miswak (tooth brush) to cure bleeding gums and used as EVMs.
Eye diseases and infections, ulcers, depressant, inflammation infirmities and bacterial diseases.
Snake bites, diarrhea, stomach problems, urinary infections, enteritis, injuries, sprains and muscular swellings.
Weak eyes sight, pain killers and narcotic effects used as tonic for body vigour.
Vigor tonic and sedative, dysentery, cough, brain memory enhancer and expectorant.
Persicaria barbata var. barbata (L.) Hara Polygonaceae MUH-1549
Bacterial infections, oxidative, oestrogenicity, fertility issues, colic pain, inflammations, urinary disorders, stomachache, and scabies.
Admixture with cake of Brassica compesstriss and used as EVMs to cure of infirmities.
Seed, fruit, leaf, root/ poultice, decoction
Flu, vomiting, urinary issues, bleeding nose, vertigo, sweetener and relief of unconsciousness.
Fruit, leaf, seed/ decoction, pickle, powder
Stomach diseases, diabetes, and kidney disorders, asthma, jaundice and used as EVMs.
Seed, Resin, leaf and bark/ decoction, tea
Pimples, tumor, and control bleeding from wounds, stomach pain, repellents of insects and mosquito.
Pimples, wounds and sore pains, constipatuon and hypolipidemic.
Cough, fever, cold, diuretic and used as EVMs.
Constipation, febrifuge, vermifuge, bacterial infections, ulcer, inflammatory infirmities and wound-healing.
Tumors, fever, cooling and tonic of the body, cough, sore throats, skin disorders anthelmintic, stomach pains and cadiotonic with hyperlepidimic effects.
Cough, asthma, snake bite, tumor, heart related diseases, snake and scorpion bites.
Rhynchosia minima (L.) DC. Leguminosae; subfamily Papilionaceae MUH-1339
Flatulaence, indigestion, fever, whooping cough and abortificient.
Rhynchosia pseudo-cajan Camb. Leguminosae; subfamily Papilionaceae MUH-1340
Flu, fever, cough, purgative and chest infections.
Skin and joints pains, diabetic drug, microbial ulcer, purgative and wormicidal.
Carminative, body tonic or vigour, sore throat, mouth bad smell and gum pains with inflammation.
Urinary issues, astringent. The leaf juice is applied for control of irritation of Urtica dioica.
Flatulence in cattle, ear pain and used as EVMs for cattle and rodents.
Insecticidal, burnt woundâs pain reliever, piles, dysentery and used as EVMs.
Schoenoplectus litoralis (Schrad.) Palla subsp. thermalis (Trabut) S.Hooper Cyperaceae MUH-1666
Carminative, bite pains, stomach worms and digestive tonic.
Schoenoplectus lacustris (L.) Palla, subsp. Lacustris Cyperaceae MUH-1667
Diuretic, astringent and cure of tumors & boils.
Febrifuge, diuretic and demulcent agent, laxative and stomach pains.
Sida cordata (Burm.f.) Borss. var. cordata. Malvaceae MUH-1300
Wound, cold, flu, sore mouth cough, cuts, headache, nasal congestion and diarrhea.
Expectorant, constipation, soar throat, pharynx problems of low voice, viral flus and cure of measles.
Abortifacient, dropsy and hepatitis, kidney problems skin diseases, hepatitis, dysentery, stomachache and tumor cure.
Solanum surratense Burm. f. Solanaceae MUH-1485
Expectorant, diuretic, cure of gonorrhea, microbial infections, anti-protective, asthma, wound healing, flu, cough and fever.
Bacterial infections, oxidative stress and diabetes
Carminative, diuretic, laxative, expectorant, astringent and vulnerary.
Fruit, leaf, wood/ paste, decoction, infusion
Diabetes, bronchitis, hyperglycemia, astringent helminthic, sore throat, asthma, dysentery, concomitant thirst and ulcers.
Leaf, whole plant, flower/ decoction, tea
Diuretic, jaundice, heart problems, bandage with eggs as paste on broken bones, viral flu infections and wormicidal.
Leaf, seed, flower, stem/ decoction, tea
Stomach and colic pains, fever, asthma and skin, haemorrhoids and diarrhea. The plant is used as source ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Dysentery, blood diseases and stomach flatulence issues.
Stomach problems, night blindness, inflammation, constipation, laxative tonic and analgesic.
Body tonic, impotence and vigour, urinary, cystitis problems and aphrodisiac.
Hay fever, jaundice, hepatitis, blood pressure, diabetes, menstrual problems and leucorrhea.
Skin, chest tumors, menstrual disorders, enhancement of lactation in mothers and itching on the body parts.
Vallaris solanacea (Roth) O. Kuntze Apocynaceae MUH-1288
Skin infections, soar throat, wounds and cuts on body pains.
Viola canescens Wall.ex Roxb. Violaceae MUH-1281
Flu, cold, fever, cough, soar throat, antipyretic, laxative in folklore tonics, malaria and tumors.
Insomnia, disability and fatigue, impotence and nervous exhaustion.
Boils, pimples and blisters, knees pains, dyspepsia, kidney problems, rheumatism, tumors, sex potential enhancer, bacterial and mycotic infirmities.
Seed, stem, leaf, wood /paste, decoction, infusion
Eye sights enhancer, carminative and digestives, stomachic fevers and toothache. The plant is used as source ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Ziziphus mauritiana Lam. var. Spontanea Rhamnaceae MUH-1329
Obesity reducer, boils & pimples, dyspepsia, stomachache, fever, cough and used as EVMs.
Ziziphus nummularia (Burm.f.) Wight & Arn. Rhamnaceae MUH-1328
Obesity, blood purifier, diarrhea, anemia, snake biting, wound healing. The plant is used as source ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
Diabetes, obesity, antimicrobial, wound healing, flu, cough and used as ethnoveterinary medicines (EVMs).
